segments.text: I like board games . I like chinese chess and draughts .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ Ve never played Chinese chess before , but I ’ Ve seen old men playing it in the street . It looks complicated .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s about as complicated as chess . The basic rule and moves are simple enough , but there are many strategies that players need to learn .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I like playing cards . I ’ m pretty good at poker . Do you play cards ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m terrible at cards and so I never play games which involve gambling , like poker . If I did , I ’ d lose all my money .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I do . It ’ s hard to find four players though , so I don ’ t play very often . Do you know anyone who plays ? If so , we could set up a game .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I can play quite well . I have a friend who likes playing , but she ’ s not very good at it . Shall I invite her to play ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure , I have a friend who play fairly well . We should find out when our friends are free and arrange a game .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll call my friend now . you call yours .
segments.speaker: S1
